snippet: A judge in Australia found that Standard & Poor’s was liable for issuing the top rating of AAA for a product she described as a “grotesquely complicated” piece of financial engineering.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column notes that legal and regulatory protections for credit rating agencies may have started to break down in the wake of financial crisis; notes federal judge in Australia has found Standard & Poor's liable for issuing top investment-grade rating of AAA for a complex and risky financial product issued by Dutch bank ABN.
lead_paragraph: A judge in Australia found that Standard & Poor’s was liable for issuing the top rating of AAA for a product she described as a “grotesquely complicated” piece of financial engineering.

headline.seo: Judge in Australia Finds Flaws in an S.&P. Triple-A Rating

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies
